New Records: James Harden surpassed Ray Allen for second on the NBA's all-time 3-point list with a pair of triples to go along with 20 points and 11 assists in a 116-105 win over the Jazz.
Cleveland Cavaliers became the 4th NBA team to start a season at 15-0.
Key Match Events: Devin Booker cooked up a season-high 44 points, including 27 in the 1st half to help Phoenix build a 16-point lead.
Julius Randle and Anthony Edwards willed the Wolves back and Randle drained a game-winning 3 at the buzzer.
Timberwolves 120, Suns 117: Randle finished with a season-high 35 points, seven assists and five 3s.

Cavaliers 128, Hornets 114: Darius Garland led the Cavs with 25 points and 12 dimes, while Ty Jerome matched his career-high in both points (24) and assists (8) to lead the Cavs to a near wire-to-wire win over the Hornets.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavs are just the fourth team to open a season 15-0, matching the second-best start in NBA history.
The defending champ Celtics on Tuesday, in an Emirates NBA Cup showdown at 7 ET on TNT.
Post-Match Reflections: Harden said postgame, “It’s an unbelievable accomplishment, Just a testament to the amount of work I’ve been putting in … I never want to take it for granted.”
Randle On His 3rd Career Game-Winner: “Coach trusted me and put me in a position to make a play, and I came through for the team.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 15-0 start is a historic feat, matching the second-best start in NBA history.
The Cavs are on a record win streak, can they avenge their Playoff exit, or will the C’s halt their historic run?
The matchup also features the league’s second-leading scorer, Anthony Davis (31.1 ppg), against the league’s second-ranked defense, as Orlando is allowing just 102.4 ppg.
